tasks.task: Engaging in agricultural entrepreneurship and expansion
subtasks: Understanding market demands and identifying profitable crops
Negotiating with export companies for produce contracts
Securing credit and financial backing for farm operations
Coordinating with fellow farmers for group funding and support
Managing and expanding greenhouse farms
Meeting production targets to meet market demand

tasks.task: Overcoming challenges faced by African farmers
subtasks: Addressing corruption in agricultural supply chains
Promoting collaboration among farmers for success
Tackling internal competition and jealousy among farmers
Collaborating with former colonial powers' descendants in farming
Navigating economic post-colonial agricultural policies and support
Leveraging success stories from neighboring countries (South Africa) in agriculture
Applying for credit cards and financing for farming equipment
Utilizing bank credit lines for agricultural enterprises
Coordinating multiple credit sources for a significant investment
Quickly establishing large-scale farming operations
Achieving high yield and harvest frequency (e.g., six weeks for lettuce)
Scaling production to meet increased demand within months
Recognizing the role of personal relationships and networks in accessing markets
Competing in a market with established players and high demand
Leveraging existing buyer relationships for product distribution
